metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7283 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in rcp in NetKit through 0.17. For an rcp operation, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client. However, the rcp client only performs cursory validation of the object name returned. A malicious rsh server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in a directory on the rcp client machine. This is similar to CVE-2019-6111.

criterions.comment: netkit-rsh: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
